title: MongoDB Sharding
subject: MongoDB
theory: Sharding distributes data across multiple machines. A sharded cluster consists of shards (replica sets), config servers (metadata), and mongos (routers). Choosing the right Shard Key is critical for even distribution.

common_mistakes.correction: Using timestamps as shard keys leads to hotspots (all writes go to the last shard). Hash the key or use a different one.

interview_questions.question: What is the role of mongos?
interview_questions.answer: It acts as a query router, directing client requests to the appropriate shard(s) based on the shard key.

real_world_use_cases.description: Storing 50TB of data. A single server cannot hold this. Sharding splits it across 20 servers.

exam_notes: Range based vs Hash based sharding.
summary: Sharding allows MongoDB to scale infinitely horizontally.
